title: Bump to version 0.14.0
Update crate dependencies
Update to rustc nightly-2019-12-05
Feature/issue 196
body:
Adds support for three new SIMD intrinsics and updates test suite accordingly. 

- `_mm_alignr_epi8`
- `_mm256_alignr_epi8`
- `_mm256_permute2x128_si256`

title: Fix links in c2rust-refactor readme to point to online manual
body:
This change should take effect on crates.io and github, and should make
the refactor commands more discoverable.

(fixes #41)

title: Improve python3 dependency awareness
body: Fixes https://github.com/immunant/c2rust/issues/187. Adds a bit more detail to the panic message and adds python3 to the dependencies listed in the README.

title: Local Ownership Analysis and Misc Rewriting Improvements

labels.name: refactorer
labels.description: This issue relates to the refactoring tool

title: Handle ownership analysis constraints correctly for extern functions
Roll to nightly 2019-09-...
body:
We need proper support for parameter attributes, which requires a newer nightly.

I split out the rustc/libsyntax pretty-printer into our own crate so we can once again forge a list of comments to be emitted in the pretty-printed output. It seemed to invasive to request this change upstream, and the pretty-printer should be easy to maintain out-of-tree.

title: Static analysis for automated rewriting
Update README.md
body: Removes superfluous word “code”  from introduction sentence.

title: Update source_walkthrough.md
body: Clarifies the preservation of comments close to a region of code and how IDs are allocated and shuffled to achieve this.

title: Track comments by source code span
body: We want to track comments that should not be attached to the beginning of items or statements, e.g., comments at the end of a block. In order to do so, we need to keep track of all C AST node spans and map comments from their place inside those spans to analogous positions with the Rust AST spans. All comment spans are assigned before translation so that we can properly move non-definition function decl comments to their definition before either is traversed during translation.

title: Split structures into inner and outer definitions to support packed-aligned structures
body: Implement support for packed-aligned structures by splitting them into an outer-aligned newtype containing an inner-packed structure with the actual fields.

title: Lua script for raw ptr -> ref/slice ref promotion
Roll nightly version to 2019-06-22 to support va_copy
body: With https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/59625 merged, we can now support `va_copy`. This PR rolls the rustc nightly version up to include that upstream change.

title: Feature/ci dev
Ensure executability for all Python with a __main__
body:
Neither of the scripts I needed to run to reproduce the robotfindskitten results was executable, which strikes me as an easily-eliminated point of friction, so here's a patch to do so.

The way I did it had the side effect of making the interpreter lines identical across all of the scripts. (Some of the existing scripts included an extra, but harmless, space.)

For each Python script with a `__main__` block, I ran each of these three steps:

- delete existing interpreter if any: `sed -i '2,$b; /^#!/d'`
- insert interpreter: `sed -i '1i#!/usr/bin/env python3'`
- set executable permission bit: `chmod a+x`

To apply those steps to the right files, I prefixed each command with:

```sh
git grep -lFw __main__ '*.py' ':^:**/__main__.py' | xargs
```

title: Don't rely on distro detection in common.on_linux
body:
Instead, just ask the platform module if this is Linux, regardless of
which distribution of Linux it might be.

title: Just ask rustc where its libraries are
body:
Instead of trying to duplicate complicated and non-portable path-construction logic, let the `rustc` which rustup picks for us just tell us what we wanted to know.

Assuming this simplification works for everyone, then we can delete a bunch of other code from `scripts/common.py`, and remove the `distro` dependency. For ease of review, though, this is just the minimal change, sans all those deletions.

title: Add shell.nix to pull in environment
body: Allows a `nix` user to pull together an ad-hoc environment to build everything.

title: Add linkage attribute to (non-gnu89) inline functions
body:
This change was prompted by a linker error in bzip2. Using the [linkage](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29603) feature and adding the `#[linkage = "external"]` attribute to inlined Rust functions (translated from non-gnu89 inlined extern functions) avoids the linker issue. This due to the way `rustc` handles functions with explicit linkage (see [mono.rs](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/9f22ddf6bb7001b884006b9528f8fc8c5b94ae8f/src/librustc/mir/mono.rs#L90)).

After additional testing, it does not seem necessary to add a `#[linkage = "internal"]` attribute on static inlined functions.

title: Add new LuaAstNode and refactor Lua interface to use it
Update support for C variadics
body: Reflect anticipated changes in Rust's implementation of C-compatible variadics.
